data.title: « COD? »
data.solution:
# Fastest/Reverse Mode Solution (Below):

string = str(input())
character = str(input())

length = len(string)

for i in range(1, length+1):
    print(string[:i] + character * (length-1))
    length-=1

#—————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————
# My Shortest Mode Solution (code length = 74 characters):
'''
s,c=input(),input()
l=len(s)
for i in range(1,l+1):print(s[:i]+c*(l-1));l-=1
'''

# @gleb734's Shortest Mode Python Solution (code length = 63 characters):
'''
s,c=open(0)
l=len(s)
for i in range(1,l):print(s[:i]+c*(l-i-1))
'''

#Rafarafa's Shortest Mode Python Solution (code length = 59 characters)
'''
w,c=open(i:=0)
while~(K:=len(w)+~(i:=i+1)):print(w[:i]+c*K)
'''
data.statement:
A hard slap in the face wakes you up in the morning. At first, you only see yellow... until you realise it's a yellow, sticky-note. When you peel it off your forehead, you see your fellow employees chuckling. You're in the office. You glance behind your to see the large intimidating frame of you boss walking away. After grunting in annoyance, you intently read the note.

(Here's the Note:)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————
Thought you could snooze quietly in your comfy chair without my noticing, eh? Well... YOU THOUGHT WRONG!

Given a string, [[word]], and character(s), [[chars]], you must output all the lines leading up to the word being completely spelt:
```
<<C???
CO??
COD?
CODE>>
```

(P.S: If you fall asleep on such a simple task as this, then you may as well GET OUT OF MY OFFICE!!!)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————

A small paper ball hits you in the back of the head, and you turn to see Gavin, one of your very few friends, gesturing towards the boss's distant form with clear concern. You realise that you had just fallen asleep again, and if it weren't for him...

You start to type the first lines of your program... but how are you going to do this?

data.stubGenerator:
read word:string(20)
read chars:string(20)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A string, [[word]], consisting of <<uppercase alphabetical>> characters.
<<Line 2:>> A string, [[chars]], consisting of <<symbolic or alphabetical>> characters
data.outputDescription: <<[[?]] Lines:>> Characters from [[word]] to form the complete word, with characters from [[chars]] to form the blanks.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A hard slap in the face wakes you up in the morning. At first, you only see yellow... until you realise it's a yellow, sticky-note. When you peel it off your forehead, you see your fellow employees chuckling. You're in the office. You glance behind your to see the large intimidating frame of you boss walking away. After grunting in annoyance, you intently read the note.

(Here's the Note:)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————
Thought you could snooze quietly in your comfy chair without my noticing, eh? Well... YOU THOUGHT WRONG!

Given a string, word, and character(s), chars, you must output all the lines leading up to the word being completely spelt:

C???
CO??
COD?
CODE


(P.S: If you fall asleep on such a simple task as this, then you may as well GET OUT OF MY OFFICE!!!)
———————————————————————————————————————————————————

A small paper ball hits you in the back of the head, and you turn to see Gavin, one of your very few friends, gesturing towards the boss's distant form with clear concern. You realise that you had just fallen asleep again, and if it weren't for him...

You start to type the first lines of your program... but how are you going to do this?




   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A string, word, consisting of uppercase alphabetical characters.
Line 2: A string, chars, consisting of symbolic or alphabetical characters

   

   

      
Output

      
? Lines: Characters from word to form the complete word, with characters from chars to form the blanks.

   

   

      
Constraints

      
0 < length of word <= 20
0 < length of chars <= 20

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
CODE
?

         

         

            
Output

            
C???
CO??
COD?
CODE
